result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan

records.addlTxt: Plea and Sentencing Hearing 1/26/17

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MA] Cases 16CF3,16CF7,16CF17,16CF103, 16CF311 and 16CM15 called together at 2:30pm
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in court, in custody with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered as to Case 16CF3, Counts #2 and #3
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered as to Case 16CF17, Counts #2 and #4
Plea of " GUILTY " entered as to Case 16CF311, Count #1
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered as to Case 16CM15, Counts #1 and #2

Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: 
--Count #1 of Case 16CF3
--Case 16CF7
--Remaining Counts of Case 16CF17
--Case 16CF103
--Remaining Counts of Case 16CF311

--uncharged read in DA Case #2016JE2218 DOV: 03/04/2016 Charge: Possession of THC, 961.41(3g)(e)--possessing 5.182 grams in a backpack in the library

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Bonilla-Galan

As to Case 16CF3, Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

As to Case 16CF3, Count #3,the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.


Conditions of Probation: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--anger management counseling & follow through with any treatment
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--comply with random drug & alcohol screening
--no contact with: KMQ(dob: 08/13/1998)
--no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition
--to pay statutory costs
--submit DNA sample 
********************************************************************


As to Case 16CF17, Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--pay statutory costs 

As to Case 16CF17, Count #4, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #2 of Case 16CF17
--pay statutory costs 

********************************************************************************
As to Case 16CF311, Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

Conditions of Probation: 
--80 hours of community service
--no acts or threats of violence
--anger management counseling & follow through with any treatment
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--comply with random drug & alcohol screening
--no contact with: KMQ(dob: 08/13/1998)
--no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition
--to pay statutory costs
--submit DNA sample 

******************************************************************************
As to Case 16CM15, Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to sentence in 16CF17
--pay statutory costs 

As to Case 16CM15, Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to sentence in 16CF17 and conccurent to the sentence in 16CM15, Count #1
--pay statutory costs 

The Court orders that bonds are to be applied accordingly to the costs, fees, assessments of all cases. Any excess is to be returned to the surety(ies)
The Court orders that any remaining balance after application of bond money, is to be paid at the rate of $30 per month beginning 3/26/17 and on the 26th of every month thereafter until paid in full or as otherwise ordered by the Court ; the Court directs the Clerk to make the alternate the total of the balance divided by 50, that is the number of days for failure to pay. 

Days Credit:
--Case 16CF3= 126 days
--Case 16CF17= 45 days
--Case 16CF311= 0 days
--Case 16CM15= 23 days

ADA Teuber has filed an order re: the destuction of firearm; Atty Hartley indicates that he does not oppose to the order
recess: 3:50pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] cases #16CF3, #16CF7, #16CF17, #16CF103, #16CF311, #16CM15 called 10:34am. 
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in court, in custody, with Attorney Christopher Hartley.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hartley requests that all cases be scheduled for plea and sentencing. 
recess 10:39am.

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on all cases on 1/25/17 at 2:30pm

Cases 16CF03 and 16CF07 called together at 8:12am [ma]
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan not in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews Court Record.
Upon inquiry of the Court, it is confirmed that Mr. Galan is currently at JCJ, he will be produced for this hearing.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

The Court finds that sureties had previously had notice of a former bail/bond forfeiture hearing, and did not appear.
The Court previously made a record regarding notice to sureties and their failure to appear.

Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan appears at 8:18am, in custody.
The Court finds that there is the proper factual basis to make the final order fofeiting the bond. 
Mr. Galan gives reasoning for return of some monies.
--no statement made by ADA Shock

The Court fofeits the entire cash bail in cases 16CF03 and 16CF07; the Court directs the Clerk to prepare proper final order, and deposit money into general fund. 

recess: 8:26am
from JA regarding Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing being copied to the def. at JCJ

Amended
Bond Covers 16CF3,16CF7,16CF17,16CF103,16CM15

[MK] cases #16CF3, #16CF7, #16CF17, #16CF103, #16CF311, #16CM15 called 3:44pm. 
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in court, in custody.   His counsel, Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley, appears by telephone.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments given on bond.

In Cases #16CF3, #16CF7, #16CF17, #16CF103, and #16CM15 the Court grants the oral Motion of the Defense to reduce the Cash Bail required amount. The Court requires a $4,000 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered [which are
 -No contact with Jericka Hinojosa, KMQ, JDH or CKJ  
-No presence within 1,000 feet of the residence of KMQ
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a vaild prescription
-To maintain absolute sobriety 
-No acts or threats of violence
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons as defined by Statute [Statute 939.22(10)]].

[Clerk's added note for clarification: Case #16CF311 is not part of this Cash Bond requirement; the Signature Bond in Case #16CF311 remains in effect.]
In regard to the pending Bail Forfeiture issue, the Court indicates that the bail forfeiture will be scheduled on a later date 
recess 4:00pm. 

NEXT:  (1) schedule a Bail Forfeiture Hearing on a later date in Cases #16CF3 and #16CF7--send notices, however the sureties are not to be sent notices of hearing per the 9/30/16 minutes  (2) Status Conference on all cases remains on the Court's calendar for 12/13/16 at 10:30am
Status conference on December 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] cases #16CF3, #16CF7, #16CF17, #16CF103, #16CF311, #16CM15 called 1:03pm. 
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in court, in custody, with Attorney Christopher L. Hartley.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

In Case #16CF311 only:  
--Mr. Bonilla Galan waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--Service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Court addresses the Bail Forfeiture that occurred last week in Cases #16CF3 and #16CF7.  Based on the information from the State that Mr. Bonilla Galan was in custody at the time of the hearing, the Court rescinds its bail forfeiture Order.  The Court will reschedule the Bail Forfeiture Hearing, however at this hearing only Mr. Bonilla Galan will have the opportunity to argue why forfeiture should not occu--the sureties have already had this opportunity;  the Court will not have the sureties get notice of this hearing.  They will get notice, in due course, of any action the Court untimately takes on the posted bails.  
Attorney Hartley orally Motions to Modify the Bond to reduce the amount.  
ADA Shock indicates that the State is not prepared to respond to this Motion today. 
The Court schedules the oral Motion to Modify Bond on October 3rd;  the Court will not require the Defense to file a Notice of Motion and Motion,  
recess 1:20pm 



NEXT:   (1) Bail Motion Hearing on 10/3/16 at 3:00pm- Attorney Hartley will call in to appear by telephone for this hearing  (2) schedule a Bail Forfeiture Hearing in Cases #16CF3 and #16CF7--the sureties are not to be sent notices of hearing on this  (3) Status Conference on all cases on all cases on 12/13/16 at 10:30am
Court's response to 9/27/16 letter from Defendant
From the defendant regarding scheduling a Bond Modification Hearing.
Letter from the State advising that the Defendant was in custody at the Jefferson County Jail on the date and time of the Bond Forfeiture Hearing
cc: DA, Def. , Attorney Hartley & Natividad Bonilla on 9/22/16 sf
From defendant regarding missed appearance for 9/19/16 BBH.

[MK] cases #16CF3 and #16CF7 called at 11:11am. 
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews Notice, verifying that the two sureties who posted the Bond total were mailed notice of today's hearing.  
The Court finds the Bond is in default, and the Court orders that it is forfeited.  
recess 11:13am.
Status conference on September 30, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Bond to cover 16CF3, 16CF7, 16CF17, 16CF103 & 16CM15

Cases 16CF3, 16CF7, 16CF17, 16CF103 & 16CM15 called at 1:26 pm [sf]
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Susan Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews warrants were issued by Judge Wambach after the defendant failed to appear at status conference.
Attorney Svehlek advises that the defendant has retained counsel on these cases.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 CASH bond to cover all cases, with previous non-monetary conditions.

Recess: 1:30 pm
NEXT: (1)  Status Conference scheduled for 9/30/16 at 1:00 pm - send notices 

(Off record: Court clarifies bond is to cover all of these cases and non-monetary conditions are to continue)

Atty. Balistreri indicates that Atty. Hartley has attempted to call Mr. Bonilla Galan numerous times this morning, and has not been able to reach him; unaware of Mr. Bonilla Galan's whereabouts
The Court finds all bonds to be in default
The Court orders all bond to be forfeit.
The Court issues bench warrants in each case, body only.

Case called at 1:30 pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in court with attorney Hagemann from the PD Office.  Defendant Jorge Luis Bonilla Galan in custody. Public Service Special Prosecutor - Atty. Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agreement, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Hagemann informs the Court that the defendant does qualify for SPD appointed counsel.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing on 1/15/16 at 9am.  

The Court requires a $501 CASH Bond, with conditions: 
-  No contact with KMQ or CKJ
-  No presence within 1,000 feet of the residence of KMQ.
recess 1:30pm
